hook.text: Medieval knights swore devotion to married noblewomen they could never be with. This was considered noble.

discovery.text: It was never meant to lead to marriage. The longing itself was the point â€” love as sweet torment.

twist.text: Scholars debate whether courtly love was real practice or literary fiction. Either way, it shaped Western romance.

climax.text: Courtly love invented the idea that desire is ennobling. Modern love still carries that DNA.

punchline.text: Medieval love glorified longing. We inherited the ache.
